t: Jeremiah 10
False Gods Contrasted with the Creator
Hear*p the word that the Lord*s has spoken to you, house of Israel.
This is what the Lord*s says: Do*pn not learn the way of the nations or*ln be terrified by signs in the heavens, although*ln the nations are terrified by them,
for*ln the customs of the peoples are worthless. Someone*ln cuts down a tree from the forest; it*ln is worked by the hands of a craftsman with a chisel.
He*ln decorates it with silver and gold. It*ln is fastened with hammer and nails, so*ln it won’t totter.
Like*ln scarecrows in a cucumber patch, their*ln idols cannot speak. They*ln must be carried because they cannot walk. Do*ln not fear them for they can do no harm— and*ln they cannot do any good.
Lord,*spn there is no one like you. You*ln are great; your*ln name is great in power.
Who*ln should not fear you, King*ln of the nations? It*ln is what you deserve. For*ln among all the wise people of the nations and*ln among all their kingdoms, there*ln is no one like you.
They*ln are both stupid and foolish, instructed*ln by worthless idols made*ln of wood!
Beaten*ln silver is brought from Tarshish and*ln gold from Uphaz. The*ln work of a craftsman and*ln of a goldsmith’s hands is*ln clothed in blue and purple, all*ln the work of skilled artisans.
But*ln the Lord*s is the true God; he*ln is the living God and eternal King. The*ln earth quakes at his wrath, and*ln the nations cannot endure his fury.
You*p are to say this to them: “The gods that did not make the heavens and the earth will perish from the earth and from under these heavens.”
He*pn made the earth by his power, established*ln the world by his wisdom, and*ln spread out the heavens by his understanding.

When*ln he thunders, the*ln waters in the heavens are in turmoil, and*ln he causes the clouds to rise from*ln the ends of the earth. He*ln makes lightning for the rain and*ln brings the wind from his storehouses.
Everyone*pn is stupid and ignorant. Every*ln goldsmith is put to shame by*ln his carved image, for*ln his cast images are a lie; there*ln is no breath in them.
They*ln are worthless, a work to be mocked. At*ln the time of their punishment they*ln will be destroyed.
Jacob’s*ln Portion is not like these because*ln he is the one who formed all things. Israel*ln is the tribe of his inheritance; the*ln Lord*s of Armies is his name.
Exile after the Siege
Gather*pn up your belongings from the ground, you*ln who live under siege.
For*p this is what the Lord*s says: Look,*pn I am flinging away the*ln land’s residents at this time and*ln bringing them such distress that*ln they will feel it.
Jeremiah Grieves
Woe*pn to me because of my brokenness — I*ln am severely wounded! I*ln exclaimed, “This is my intense suffering, but*ln I must bear it.”
My*ln tent is destroyed; all*ln my tent cords are snapped. My*ln sons have departed from me and are no more. I*ln have no one to pitch my tent again or*ln to hang up my curtains.
For*ln the shepherds are stupid: They*ln don’t seek the Lord.*s Therefore*ln they have not prospered, and*ln their whole flock is scattered.
Listen!*ln A noise - it is coming — a*ln great commotion from the land to the north. The*ln cities of Judah will be made desolate, a*ln jackals’ den.
I*pn know, Lord,*s that*ln a person’s way of life is not his own; no*ln one who walks determines his own steps.
Discipline*ln me, Lord,*s but with justice — not*ln in your anger, or*ln you will reduce me to nothing.

Pour*ln out your wrath on the nations that*ln don’t recognize you and*ln on the families that*ln don’t call on your name, for*ln they have consumed Jacob; they*ln have consumed him and finished him off and*ln made his homeland desolate.
